trans-unit.source: Retrieves information about the current system

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves information about the current system

target.mrk: Retrieves information about the current system

trans-unit.source: Returns the array containing the following information:

seg-source.mrk: Returns the array containing the following information:

target.mrk: Returns the array containing the following information:

trans-unit.source: [0] - The processor architecture of the installed operating system ($PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE_*).

seg-source.mrk: [0] - The processor architecture of the installed operating system ($PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE_*).

target.mrk: [0] - The processor architecture of the installed operating system ($PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE_*).

trans-unit.source: [1] - The page size and the granularity of page protection and commitment.

seg-source.mrk: [1] - The page size and the granularity of page protection and commitment.

target.mrk: [1] - The page size and the granularity of page protection and commitment.

trans-unit.source: [2] - A pointer to the lowest memory address accessible to applications and dynamic-link libraries (DLLs).

seg-source.mrk: [2] - A pointer to the lowest memory address accessible to applications and dynamic-link libraries (DLLs).

target.mrk: [2] - A pointer to the lowest memory address accessible to applications and dynamic-link libraries (DLLs).

trans-unit.source: [3] - A pointer to the highest memory address accessible to applications and DLLs.

seg-source.mrk: [3] - A pointer to the highest memory address accessible to applications and DLLs.

target.mrk: [3] - A pointer to the highest memory address accessible to applications and DLLs.

trans-unit.source: [4] - A mask representing the set of processors configured into the system. Bit 0 is processor 0; bit 31 is processor 31.

seg-source.mrk: [4] - A mask representing the set of processors configured into the system.
Bit 0 is processor 0; bit 31 is processor 31.

target.mrk: [4] - A mask representing the set of processors configured into the system.
Bit 0 is processor 0; bit 31 is processor 31.

trans-unit.source: [5] - The number of physical processors in the system.

seg-source.mrk: [5] - The number of physical processors in the system.

target.mrk: [5] - The number of physical processors in the system.

trans-unit.source: [6] - An obsolete member that is retained for compatibility ($PROCESSOR_*).

seg-source.mrk: [6] - An obsolete member that is retained for compatibility ($PROCESSOR_*).

target.mrk: [6] - An obsolete member that is retained for compatibility ($PROCESSOR_*).

trans-unit.source: [7] - The granularity for the starting address at which virtual memory can be allocated.

seg-source.mrk: [7] - The granularity for the starting address at which virtual memory can be allocated.

target.mrk: [7] - The granularity for the starting address at which virtual memory can be allocated.

trans-unit.source: [9] - The architecture-dependent processor revision (0x0000xxyy; xx - model; yy - stepping).

seg-source.mrk: [9] - The architecture-dependent processor revision (0x0000xxyy; xx - model; yy - stepping).

target.mrk: [9] - The architecture-dependent processor revision (0x0000xxyy; xx - model; yy - stepping).
